cluster_classes.class_description: Biological processes involved in caterpillar growth and development, including rapid size increase and the periodic shedding of the external skin (molting).
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Caterpillars grow rapidly and shed their skin several times as they grow.

members.entity_description: The fast increase in size experienced by caterpillars during the larval stage.
Biological process in which caterpillars shed and replace their external skin multiple times as they grow.

remarks: This class is now effectively empty after splitting; consider deprecating or hiding it from primary use.

cluster_classes.class_description: The external body covering of caterpillars, including the skin and associated surface structures that can be shed and replaced during growth and molting.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: The external anatomical covering of caterpillars that is repeatedly shed and replaced during growth.

members.entity_description: The external anatomical covering of caterpillars that is repeatedly shed and replaced during growth.

splits.name: Caterpillar Rapid Growth
splits.description: The rapid increase in size and mass experienced by caterpillars during the larval stage.

splits.name: Caterpillar Molting
splits.description: The biological process by which caterpillars periodically shed and replace their external skin as they grow.

args.justification: The original class bundles two distinct biological processes (growth vs. molting) that are better modeled as separate process classes for clarity and reuse.
args.remark: Source class has been decomposed into distinct growth and molting process classes; consider deprecating or repurposing this container class in a later cleanup step.

args.new_description: The rapid increase in size and mass experienced by caterpillars during the larval stage.
args.justification: Assign a coherent Class_Group and confirm metadata so this new growth-focused process class is properly connected to other caterpillar biology classes.

args.new_description: The periodic shedding and replacement of a caterpillar's external skin (integument) during growth.
args.justification: Assign a coherent Class_Group and clarify that this class specifically represents the molting process, which is closely related to integument structure.

args.new_description: Former umbrella class for caterpillar growth and molting processes; entities have been moved into more specific subclasses.
args.remark: This class is now effectively empty after splitting; consider deprecating or hiding it from primary use.
args.justification: Update the legacy source class metadata to reflect that it has been decomposed, preventing future misinterpretation as an active process class.

args.new_description: The external anatomical covering of caterpillars, including the skin and associated surface structures that are shed and replaced during growth and molting.
args.justification: Confirm and slightly refine the description while keeping the shared Class_Group so that this anatomical class remains clearly linked to related growth and molting process classes.

executed_decisions.justification: The original class bundles two distinct biological processes (growth vs. molting) that are better modeled as separate process classes for clarity and reuse.
executed_decisions.remark: Source class has been decomposed into distinct growth and molting process classes; consider deprecating or repurposing this container class in a later cleanup step.
